ojc.ahni.transcriber

Class HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN

  • java.lang.Object
    • ojc.ahni.transcriber.HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN
  • Enclosing class:
    HyperNEATTranscriber<T extends Activator>

    public class HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a wrapper for an Activator that represents a CPPN.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN

        public HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN(Chromosome genotype)
                          throws TranscriberException
        Throws:
        TranscriberException

    • Method Detail

      • setSourceCoordinates

        public void setSourceCoordinates(double x,
                        double y)
        Set the coordinates of the source neuron in a two-dimensional substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX).
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
        y - The y coordinate, range should be [0, 1].

      • setSourceCoordinates

        public void setSourceCoordinates(double x,
                        double y,
                        double z)
        Set the coordinates of the source neuron in a three-dimensional substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX). If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
        y - The y coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
        z - The z coordinate, range should be [0, 1].

      • setSourceCoordinates

        public void setSourceCoordinates(Point p)
        Set the coordinates of the source neuron in a substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX). If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        p - A Point containing the coordinates of the source neuron. Coordinates should be in range [0, 1].

      • setSourceCoordinatesFromGridIndices

        public void setSourceCoordinatesFromGridIndices(int x,
                                       int y,
                                       int z)
        Set the coordinates of the source neuron specified by the given indices into a grid-based substrate. If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored. Subclasses of HyperNEATTranscriber should generally use this method instead of directly specifying coordinates as this method supports specifying arbitrary coordinates for neurons via HyperNEATTranscriber.NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER.
        Parameters:
        x - The index of the source neuron in the X dimension.
        y - The index of the source neuron in the Y dimension.
        z - The index of the source neuron in the Z dimension.

      • setTargetCoordinates

        public void setTargetCoordinates(double x,
                        double y)
        Set the coordinates of the source neuron in a two-dimensional substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX).
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
        y - The y coordinate, range should be [0, 1].

      • setTargetCoordinates

        public void setTargetCoordinates(double x,
                        double y,
                        double z)
        Set the coordinates of the source neuron in a three-dimensional substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX). If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
        y - The y coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
        z - The z coordinate, range should be [0, 1].

      • setTargetCoordinates

        public void setTargetCoordinates(Point p)
        Set the coordinates of the target neuron in a substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX). If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        p - A Point containing the coordinates of the target neuron. Coordinates should be in range [0, 1].

      • setTargetCoordinatesFromGridIndices

        public void setTargetCoordinatesFromGridIndices(int x,
                                       int y,
                                       int z)
        Set the coordinates of the target neuron specified by the given indices into a grid-based substrate. If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored. Subclasses of HyperNEATTranscriber should generally use this method instead of directly specifying coordinates as this method supports specifying arbitrary coordinates for neurons via HyperNEATTranscriber.NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER.
        Parameters:
        x - The index of the target neuron in the X dimension.
        y - The index of the target neuron in the Y dimension.
        z - The index of the target neuron in the Z dimension.

      • query

        public double query()
        Query this CPPN.
        Returns:
        The value of the (first) weight output. Other outputs can be retrieved with the various get methods.

      • query

        public double query(double sx,
           double sy,
           double tx,
           double ty)
        Query this CPPN with the specified coordinates.
        Returns:
        The value of the (first) weight output. Other outputs can be retrieved with the various get methods.

      • query

        public double query(double sx,
           double sy,
           double sz,
           double tx,
           double ty,
           double tz)
        Query this CPPN with the specified coordinates.
        Returns:
        The value of the (first) weight output. Other outputs can be retrieved with the various get methods.

      • query

        public double query(Point source,
           Point target)
        Query this CPPN with the specified coordinates.
        Returns:
        The value of the (first) weight output. Other outputs can be retrieved with the various get methods.

      • queryWithGridIndices

        public double queryWithGridIndices(int sx,
                          int sy,
                          int sz,
                          int tx,
                          int ty,
                          int tz)
        Query this CPPN with the specified grid indices, see setSourceCoordinatesFromGridIndices(int, int, int) and setTargetCoordinatesFromGridIndices(int, int, int). Subclasses of HyperNEATTranscriber should generally use this method instead of directly specifying coordinates as this method supports specifying arbitrary coordinates for neurons via HyperNEATTranscriber.NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER.
        Returns:
        The value of the (first) weight output. Other outputs can be retrieved with the various get methods.

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight()
        Get the value of the weight. Should be called after calling query().

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight(int sourceLayerIndex)
        Get the value of the weight for the specified layer in a layered feed-forward network encoded with HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING set to false. Should be called after calling query().

      • getBiasWeight

        public double getBiasWeight()
        Get the value of the weight for a bias connection. Should be called after calling query(). The bias is usually queried for a target neuron after setting the source coordinate values to 0.

      • getBiasWeight

        public double getBiasWeight(int sourceLayerIndex)
        Get the value of the weight for a bias connection for the specified layer in a layered feed-forward network encoded with HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING set to false. Should be called after calling query(). The bias is usually queried for a target neuron after setting the source coordinate values to 0.

      • getLEO

        public double getLEO()
        Get the value of the link expression output (see HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LEO). Should be called after calling query().

      • getLEO

        public double getLEO(int sourceLayerIndex)
        Get the value of the link expression output (see HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LEO) for the specified layer in a layered feed-forward network encoded with HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING set to false. Should be called after calling query().
